title: Core/stats shows wrong `totalBytes` during sync

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
https://forum.rclone.org/t/core-stats-during-sync-shows-wrong-totalbytes/27113


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I report here the information from the forum post:
Statistics from the HTTP API _core/stats_ show wrong value in the field **totalBytes** while a _sync_ is in progress.

Note: I noticed that after each single file transfer is done, the field **totalBytes** increases, and its value is the sum of the already transferred files + the file currently being transferred.

I am not familiar at all with the codebase, but after a quick search I stumbled upon [this line](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/4dfcf6899dbf5234cf65ff01b6c7df5362d2f841/fs/accounting/stats.go#L294).
Maybe there is something going on with `transferQueueSize`, such that it is growing only with the file that is being transferred, instead of counting also the one that must still be picked up to be sent?

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.56.2
- os/version: linuxmint 20.1 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 5.11.0-25-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.16.8
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux Mint, 64bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Backblaze B2, local


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
In the first terminal start a sync:
```
rclone --verbose --bwlimit=5k --transfers=1 --stats 10s --rc sync /var/log/ /tmp/test-logs/
```

In the second terminal ask for stats using `rclone rc`:
```
rclone -vv rc core/stats
```
